data.title: Sarah Vaughan/Dori Caymmi
data.text:
MúsicaBrasileira

Post by Duane Shimizu

However, on track 2 of the album, which is titled

"Romance," Paulo Cesar Pinheiro is given credit as one of the song's

authors, so there must a Portuguese version somewhere.

Duane,

I was also very puzzled with that after your note. Listening to Sarah's

rendition, I kept hearing that song in Nana Caymmi's voice. So, I began

listening to Nana's CDs... I checked with a friend of mine, too, and I

believe we have the song figured out. We believe it's "Velho Piano."

It was recorded by Nana, Dori and even Fafá de Belém (in that nice MPB

album she did in 2000. Anyway, the rendition with Nana & Cesar Camargo

Mariano is outstanding.

--

Egídio

http://thebml.com/

http://MusicaBrasileira.org/

BR6 David Pietro Heloísa Fernandes

Lenine & +

Daniella Thompson

On [Sarah's 'Brazilian Romance'] album [...] on track 2 of the album,

which is titled "Romance," Paulo Cesar Pinheiro is given credit as

one of the song's authors, so there must a Portuguese version

somewhere.

There is. The original is also called "Romance." It received its first

recording by the very talented paulista singer Ney Mesquita, who died

last year at the age of 36 (if memory serves).

Ney's CD, titled 'Canções de Dorival e Dori Caymmi' (Dabliú DB 0049)

is wonderful. Eduardo Gudin arranged all the tracks and plays violão

on some of them.

In my July 2001 article on Dabliú Discos I wrote this about the disc:

"This fine album was released before the recent spate of Caymmi

tributes, and it's a mystery why it never emerged from obscurity, given

the imaginative choice of material, the singer's beautiful voice and

interpretations, and the excellent arrangements by Eduardo Gudin, who

also produced and plays guitar on some tracks. The repertoire is

divided almost equally between the father's and the son's

compositions."

"Romance" is a voice & piano recording. The pianist is Rogério

Rochlitz.

I could post the lyrics if desired.

--

Daniella

_______
